==Determining the number of channels of an ndarray==

OpenCV supports multi-channel arrays. When converting an ndarray into an OpenCV's array, it is essential to know if the last index of the ndarray represents the channel. PyOpenCV has a simple mechanism to detect this bit of information:

    last_index_is_channel = "1 <= last_dimension <= 4" and "ndarray_is_contiguous_up_to_the_second_last_dimension"

If you want to explicitly specify whether the last index is the channel, then just set:
    arr.last_index_is_channel = True or False
where 'arr' is your ndarray.
